moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: 3. Bb5 - standard moves of The Ruy Lopez.
moves.3... Nf6: 3. ......... Nf6 - ignores the threat of the exchange on c6 and attacks the e pawn.
moves.4. O-O Nxe4 5. d4 exd4 6. Re1: 6. Re1 - two pawns have been sacrificed - this move tries to win a piece.  I succeed in doing this but at quite a cost and I end up falling behind in development in trying to win this piece.
moves.6... f5 7. Nxd4 Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Qe7 9. f3: 9. f3 - attacks the pinned knight but black has a pin of his own.
moves.9... Qc5 10. Qxc5 Bxc5+ 11. Kh1: 11. Kh1 - in hindsight this may have been a bad move as Henry is stuck in the corner for virtually the rest of the game and will get in the way of his army.  Perhaps Kf1 was preferable.
moves.11... c6 12. Bd2 d5 13. fxe4 fxe4 14. Bf: 14. Bf1 - I try to get my pieces out but with that black pawn chain I think I am going to get badly cramped.
moves.14... Rf8 15. Nc3 Bf5: 15. .......... Bf5 - black is fully developed and those bishops not to mention his rooks are going to be very dangerous indeed.
moves.16. h3 Bg6 17. Re2 O-O-O 18. g4: 18. g4? - I think this may be the loser here, perhaps g3 was better, at least that would have allowed me to play Bg2 in short order and get out of this bind.
moves.18... h5 19. Kg2 Rf3 20. Na4 Bd6 21. Be1: 21. Be1 - I am getting more and more bottled up.
24. .......... Rxf1 !!! - this brilliancy kills all resistance and will lead to ruinous loss of material due to the checks that black has up his sleeve.  This was a dreadful experience.  How I got into this mess I will never know!  Maybe you the jury can help.  Cheers.  Joanne

opening: Ruy Lopez (C67), open Berlin defence, l'Hermet variation
